title: How to play MP3 files on a CD player - Quora

response.answer_text: You need an external USB DVD Writer, which costs about $25, mine is a LG Slim Portable DVD Writer which is compatible with Windows 10. Then you have to open Windows Media Player and insert a blank Audio CD choose a data CD so mp3 files can be copied to CD without being encoded in audio data , these have 700MB capacity so you’ll be able to burn around 90 songs, or 5 albums with 18 songs each álbum. This is much less expensive than burning audio CD which is in WAV format and only can store 80 minutes per disc.

You can only play CDs with MP3 files recorded on it if the CD player has that ability. There are not many CD players that can also process MP3, and usually, good quality CD players don’t do it. On the other hand, many cheap DVD players from the early 2000’s can play CDs with MP3 files.
